types.description: Indicates the type of a Node, which can be one of addressBook, contact, or mailingList.
A node representing an address book.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

contacts.description: A list of contacts held by this node's address book or mailing list.

mailingLists.description: A list of mailingLists in this node's address book.

functions.name: openUI
functions.description: Opens the address book user interface.

functions.name: closeUI
functions.description: Closes the address book user interface.

functions.name: list

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true, results will include contacts and mailing lists for each address book.

functions.description: Gets a list of the user's address books, optionally including all contacts and mailing lists.

functions.name: get

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true, results will include contacts and mailing lists for this address book.

functions.description: Gets a single address book, optionally including all contacts and mailing lists.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new, empty address book.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Renames an address book.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes an address book, and all associated contacts and mailing lists.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when an address book is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when an address book is renamed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when an addressBook is deleted.

types.description: A node representing a contact in an address book.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

types.description:
A set of properties for a particular contact. For a complete list of properties that Thunderbird uses, see https://hg.mozilla.org/comm-central/file/tip/mailnews/addrbook/public/nsIAbCard.idl
It is also possible to store custom properties. The custom property name however may only use a to z, A to Z, 1 to 9 and underscores.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all the contacts in the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: quickSearch

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the address book to search. If not specified, all address books are searched.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: One or more space-separated terms to search for.

functions.description: Gets all contacts matching searchString in the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets a single contact.

functions.name: create

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assigns the contact an id. If an existing contact has this id, an exception is thrown.

functions.description: Adds a new contact to the address book with the id parentId.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Edits the properties of a contact. To remove a property, specify it as null.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes a contact from the address book. The contact is also removed from any mailing lists it is a member of.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a contact is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a contact is changed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when a contact is removed from an address book.

types.description: A node representing a mailing list.

id.description: The unique identifier for the node. IDs are unique within the current profile, and they remain valid even after the program is restarted.

readOnly.description: Indicates if the object is read-only. Currently this returns false in all cases, as read-only address books are ignored by the API.

contacts.description: A list of contacts held by this node's address book or mailing list.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all the mailing lists in the address book with id parentId.

functions.name: get
functions.description: Gets a single mailing list.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates a new mailing list in the address book with id parentId.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Edits the properties of a mailing list.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Removes the mailing list.

functions.name: addMember
functions.description: Adds a contact to the mailing list with id id. If the contact and mailing list are in different address books, the contact will also be copied to the list's address book.

functions.name: listMembers
functions.description: Gets all contacts that are members of the mailing list with id id.

functions.name: removeMember
functions.description: Removes a contact from the mailing list with id id. This does not delete the contact from the address book.

events.name: onCreated
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is created.

events.name: onUpdated
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is changed.

events.name: onDeleted
events.description: Fired when a mailing list is deleted.

events.name: onMemberAdded
events.description: Fired when a contact is added to the mailing list.

events.name: onMemberRemoved
events.description: Fired when a contact is removed from the mailing list.
